biogHist.abstract: Child neglect has been defined in a series of Tasmanian child welfare acts from 1867 onwards. According to the 1867 Industrial Schools Act, it meant a child found begging, 'wandering' and without a home, 'proper guardianship', or apparent subsistence, living with a reputed thief or having only one parent who was in gaol. Successive acts widened the definition. In 2014, the 1997 Children, Young Persons and their Families Act is in force. It defines neglect as 'sexual abuse' or 'physical or emotional injury or other abuse', failure to maintain, supervise or send to school.
